result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cole David John Goertz

records.addlTxt:
1:02 PM Defendant Cole David John GOERTZ appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney John A Birdsall appeared by video for Cole David John GOERTZ.  Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that grounds exist for joinder of 20CF323, 22CF35, and 22CF92.
The court finds that it is not proper to join 22CF228 and denies joining it.
The court takes the position that the defendant will not be substantially prejudiced by joinder of 20CF323, 22CF35 and 22CF92.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Scheduling conference on November 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant in custody.   
State filed a motion for joinder of cases on 20 CF 323, 22 CF 35, 22 CF 92 and 22 CF 228.   Defense objects.   Court will issue an oral decision on 09-07-22 at 1:00 p.m.   
Minutes.
Status conference on August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:50 a.m.  Defendant in custody.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Status conference scheduled for 5/31/22, 4:00 p.m., Br. 1 (w/Br. 1 matters)
Minutes.
Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 05-12-22 at 10:30 a.m.   Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant is to have no contact with M.S. DOB: 02-24-83 and anyone under the age of 18.   
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
